metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
CHARLESTON CHAPTER
OF THE
A. Philip Randolph Institute
119 SPRING STREET
UPSTAIRS
CHARLESTON, SOUTH CAROLINA 29403

July 21 , 1980

Mr. Adam Johnson:

Congratulations on the recent settlement agreement, we have discussed
in the past. The importance of voter registration, voter education
and Get-Out-The-Vote campaign on election day.

We are encouraged by your interest in the A. Philip Randolph Institute.
and its function and we have been informed of the victory at the St.
Stephens Knit Wear Plant Shop by Ms. Leola Flagler acting shop chairman.

Mr. James Haigler, Rep. of A.C.T. two and I would like to visit St.
Stephen August 2, 1980 to invite your union participation in the A.
Philip Randolph Institute. We have written Ms. Flagler also, and would
like a joint meeting if this is possible.

Please reply and inform me if 6:00 p.m. at your Union Hall is appropriate.

Sincerely,
Isaiah Bennett
Isaiah Bennett,
President

P.S. Please inform members to be their also.
